 1242: external_editor(Config) ->
 1243:     case os:find_executable("nano") of
 1244:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1245:         _ ->
 1246:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1247:             try
 1248:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1249:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1250:                 send_tty(Term, "\"some text with\nnewline in it\""),
 1251:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1252:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"),
 1253:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1254:                 check_content(Term,"\"some text with\\s*\n\\s*newline in it\""),
 1255:                 send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1256:                 send_tty(Term, "still"),
 1257:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1258:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1259:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1260:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1261:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"still\\s*\n\\s*.+\\s*some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1262:                 send_tty(Term,".\n"),
 1263:                 check_content(Term,"\\Q\"still\\nsome text with\\nnewline in it\"\\E"),
 1264:                 ok
 1265:             after
 1266:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1267:                 ok
 1268:             end
 1269:     end.
 1270: 
 1271: external_editor_visual(Config) ->
 1272:     case os:find_executable("vim") of
 1273:         false ->
 1274:             {skip, "vim is not installed"};
 1275:         _ ->
 1276:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1277:             try
 1278:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1279:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1280:                 check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1281:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"VISUAL\",\"vim -u DEFAULTS -U NONE -i NONE\").\n"),
 1282:                 check_content(Term, "4>"),
 1283:                 send_tty(Term,"\"hello"),
 1284:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% Open vim
 1285:                 check_content(Term, "^\"hello"),
 1286:                 send_tty(Term, "$"), %% Set cursor at end
 1287:                 send_tty(Term, "a"), %% Enter insert mode at end
 1288:                 check_content(Term, "-- INSERT --"),
 1289:                 send_tty(Term, "\"."),
 1290:                 send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1291:                 send_tty(Term,":wq"),
 1292:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1293:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\"[.]$"),
 1294:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1295:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\""),
 1296:                 check_content(Term, "5>$")
 1297:             after
 1298:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1299:                 ok
 1300:             end
 1301:     end.
 1302: 
 1303: external_editor_unicode(Config) ->
 1304:     NanoPath = os:find_executable("nano"),
 1305:     case NanoPath of
 1306:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1307:         _ ->
 1308:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1309:             try
 1310:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1311:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1312:                 send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1313:                 check_content(Term,"3> " ++ hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1314:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% open external editor (nano)
 1315:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1316:                 send_tty(Term, "still "),
 1317:                 check_content(Term,"\nstill "),
 1318:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1319:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1320:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1321:                 check_content(Term,"still "++hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1322:                 ok
 1323:             after
 1324:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1325:                 ok
 1326:             end
 1327:     end.
 1328: 
 1329: %% There used to be a race condition when using shell:start_interactive where
 1330: %% the newline handling of standard_error did not change correctly to compensate
 1331: %% for the tty changing to canonical mode
 1332: shell_standard_error_nlcr(Config) ->
 1333: 
 1334:     [
 1335:      begin
 1336:          Term = setup_tty([{env,[{"TERM",TERM}]},{args, ["-noshell"]} | Config]),
 1337:          try
 1338:              rpc(Term, io, format, [standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", []]),
 1339:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest$"),
 1340:              rpc(Term, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(),
 1341:                                 io:format(standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", [])
 1342:                        end),
 1343:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest(\n|.)*test\ntest\ntest")
 1344:          after
 1345:              stop_tty(Term)
 1346:          end
 1347:      end || TERM <- ["dumb",os:getenv("TERM")]].
 1348: 
 1349: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1350: shell_suspend(Config) ->
 1351: 
 1352:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1353:     %% In order to suspend `erl` we need it to run in a shell that has job control
 1354:     %% so we start the peer within a tmux window instead of having it be the original
 1355:     %% process.
 1356:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1357: 
 1358:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1359:               post_process_args =>
 1360:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1361:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs =
 1362:                                       lists:join(
 1363:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1364:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1365:                         end
 1366:             },
 1367: 
 1368: 
 1369:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1370: 
 1371:     try
 1372:         send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1373:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1374:         send_tty(Term, "C-Z"),
 1375:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1376:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1377:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1378:         send_tty(Term, "M-l"),
 1379:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1380:         check_location(Term,{0,width(hard_unicode())}),
 1381:         ok
 1382:     after
 1383:         stop_tty(Term),
 1384:         ok
 1385:     end.
 1386: 
 1387: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1388: shell_full_queue(Config) ->
 1389: 
 1390:     [throw({skip,"Need unbuffered to run"}) || os:find_executable("unbuffered") =:= false],
 1391: 
 1392:     %% In order to fill the read buffer of the terminal we need to get a
 1393:     %% bit creative. We first need to start erl in bash in order to be
 1394:     %% able to get access to job control for suspended processes.
 1395:     %% We then also wrap `erl` in `unbuffer -p` so that we can suspend
 1396:     %% that program in order to block writing to stdout for a while.
 1397: 
 1398:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1399:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1400: 
 1401:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1402:               post_process_args =>
 1403:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1404:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1405:                                       lists:join(
 1406:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1407:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1408:                         end
 1409:             },
 1410: 
 1411: 
 1412:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1413: 
 1414:     UnbufferedPid = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term,os,getpid,[])),
 1415: 
 1416:     WriteUntilStopped =
 1417:         fun F(Char) ->
 1418:                 rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char],[]]),
 1419:                 put(bytes,get(bytes,0)+1),
 1420:                 receive
 1421:                     stop ->
 1422:                         rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char+1],[]])
 1423:                 after 0 -> F(Char)
 1424:                 end
 1425:         end,
 1426: 
 1427:     WaitUntilBlocked =
 1428:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
 1429:                 (fun F(Cnt) ->
 1430:                          receive
 1431:                              {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} = Down ->
 1432:                                  ct:fail({io_format_did_not_block, Down})
 1433:                          after 1000 ->
 1434:                                  ok
 1435:                          end,
 1436:                          case process_info(Pid,dictionary) of
 1437:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,Cnt}]} ->
 1438:                                  ct:log("Bytes until blocked: ~p~n",[Cnt]),
 1439:                                  %% Add one extra byte as for
 1440:                                  %% the current blocking call
 1441:                                  Cnt + 1;
 1442:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,NewCnt}]} ->
 1443:                                  F(NewCnt)
 1444:                          end
 1445:                  end)(0)
 1446:         end,
 1447: 
 1448:     try
 1449:         %% First test that we can suspend and then resume
 1450:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1451:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1452:         {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($a) end),
 1453:         WaitUntilBlocked(Pid, Ref),
 1454:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1455:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1456:         Pid ! stop,
 1457:         check_content(Term,"b$"),
 1458: 
 1459:         send_tty(Term, "."),
 1460:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1461: 
 1462:         %% Then we test that all characters are written when system
 1463:         %% is terminated just after writing
 1464:         {ok,Cols} = rpc(Term,io,columns,[user]),
 1465:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1466:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1467:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1468:         {Pid2, Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($c) end),
 1469:         Bytes = WaitUntilBlocked(Pid2, Ref2) - 1,
 1470:         stop_tty(Term),
 1471:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1472:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1473:         check_content(
 1474:           fun() ->
 1475:                   tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])
 1476:           end, lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(Cols,$c) ++ "\n" ||
 1477:                                  _ <- lists:seq(1,(Bytes) div Cols)]
 1478:                              ++ [lists:duplicate((Bytes) rem Cols,$c)])),
 1479:         ct:log("~ts",[tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])]),
 1480:         ok
 1481:     after
 1482:         stop_tty(Term),
 1483:         ok
 1484:     end.
 1485: 
 1486: get(Key,Default) ->
 1487:     case get(Key) of
 1488:         undefined ->
 1489:             Default;
 1490:         Value ->
 1491:             Value
 1492:     end.
 1493: 
 1494: %% A list of unicode graphemes that are notoriously hard to render
 1495: hard_unicode() ->
 1496:     ZWJ =
 1497:         case os:type() of
 1498:             %% macOS has very good rendering of ZWJ,
 1499:             %% but the cursor does not agree with it..
 1500:             {unix, darwin} -> [];
 1501:             _ -> [[16#1F91A,16#1F3FC]]    % Hand with skintone 
 1502:         end,
 1503:     [[16#1f600],             % Smilie 
 1504:     "",                   % Hangul
 1505:     "Z","a","l","g","o" %% Vertically stacked chars
 1506:      %%"",            % Zero width joiner
 1507:      %%""                % Zero width joiner
 1508:      | ZWJ].
 1509: 
 1510: hard_unicode_match(Config) ->
 1511:     ["\\Q",[unicode_to_octet(Config, U) || U <- hard_unicode()],"\\E"].
 1512: 
 1513: unicode_to_octet(Config, U) ->
 1514:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1515:         unicode -> U;
 1516:         latin1 -> unicode_to_octet(U)
 1517:     end.
 1518: 
 1519: unicode_to_octet(U) ->
 1520:     [if Byte >= 128 -> [$\\,integer_to_list(Byte,8)];
 1521:         true -> Byte
 1522:      end || <<Byte>> <= unicode:characters_to_binary(U)].
 1523: 
 1524: unicode_to_hex(Config, U) ->
 1525:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1526:         unicode -> U;
 1527:         latin1 -> unicode_to_hex(U)
 1528:     end.
 1529: 
 1530: unicode_to_hex(U) when is_integer(U) ->
 1531:     unicode_to_hex([U]);
 1532: unicode_to_hex(Us) ->
 1533:     [if U < 128 -> U;
 1534:         U < 512 -> ["\\",integer_to_list(U,8)];
 1535:         true -> ["\\x{",integer_to_list(U,16),"}"]
 1536:      end || U <- Us].
 1537: 
 1538: width(C, Str) ->
 1539:     case ?config(encoding, C) of
 1540:         unicode -> width(Str);
 1541:         latin1 -> width(unicode_to_octet(Str))
 1542:     end.
 1543: width(Str) ->
 1544:     lists:sum(
 1545:       [npwcwidth(CP) || CP <- lists:flatten(Str)]).
 1546: 
 1547: npwcwidth(CP) ->
 1548:     try prim_tty:npwcwidth(CP)
 1549:     catch error:undef ->
 1550:             if CP =:= 16#D55C ->
 1551:                     2; %% 
 1552:                CP =:= 16#1f91A ->
 1553:                     2; %% hand
 1554:                CP =:= 16#1F3Fc ->
 1555:                     2; %% Skintone
 1556:                CP =:= 16#1f600 ->
 1557:                     2; %% smilie
 1558:                true ->
 1559:                     case lists:member(CP, [775,776,780,785,786,787,788,791,793,794,
 1560:                                            804,813,848,852,854,858,871,875,878]) of
 1561:                         true ->
 1562:                             0;
 1563:                         false ->
 1564:                             1
 1565:                     end
 1566:             end
 1567:     end.
 1568: 
 1569: tmux([Cmd|_] = Command) when is_list(Cmd) ->
 1570:     tmux(lists:concat(Command));
 1571: tmux(Command) ->
 1572:     string:trim(os:cmd(["tmux ",Command])).
 1573: 
 1574: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, Fun) ->
 1575:     erpc:call(N, Fun).
 1576: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, M, F, A) ->
 1577:     erpc:call(N, M, F, A).
 1578: 
 1579: %% Setup a TTY, but do not type anything in terminal
 1580: setup_tty(Config) ->
 1581:     Name = maps:get(name,proplists:get_value(peer, Config, #{}),
 1582:                     peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path, Config))),
 1583: 
 1584:     Envs = lists:flatmap(fun({Key,Value}) ->
 1585:                                  ["-env",Key,Value]
 1586:                          end, proplists:get_value(env,Config,[])),
 1587: 
 1588:     ExtraArgs = proplists:get_value(args,Config,[]),
 1589: 
 1590:     ExecArgs = case os:getenv("TMUX_DEBUG") of
 1591:                    "strace" ->
 1592:                        STraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1593:                                                  Name++".strace"),
 1594:                        ct:pal("Link to strace: file://~ts", [STraceLog]),
 1595:                        [os:find_executable("strace"),"-f",
 1596:                         "-o",STraceLog,
 1597:                         "-e","trace=all",
 1598:                         "-e","read=0,1,2",
 1599:                         "-e","write=0,1,2"
 1600:                        ] ++ string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all);
 1601:                    "rr" ->
 1602:                        [os:find_executable("cerl"),"-rr"];
 1603:                    _ ->
 1604:                        string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all)
 1605:                end,
 1606:     DefaultPeerArgs = #{ name => Name,
 1607:                          exec =>
 1608:                              {os:find_executable("tmux"),
 1609:                               ["new-window","-n",Name,"-d","--"] ++ ExecArgs },
 1610: 
 1611:                          args => ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1612:                                   "-connect_all","false",
 1613: %                                  "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1614:                                   "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1615:                                   "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1616:                                   "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1617:                                  ] ++ Envs ++ ExtraArgs,
 1618:                          detached => false
 1619:                        },
 1620: 
 1621:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
 1622:         ?CT_PEER(maps:merge(proplists:get_value(peer,Config,#{}),
 1623:                             DefaultPeerArgs)),
 1624: 
 1625:     Self = self(),
 1626: 
 1627:     %% By default peer links with the starter. For these TCs we however only
 1628:     %% want the peer to die if we die, so we create a "unidirection link" using
 1629:     %% monitors.
 1630:     spawn(fun() ->
 1631:                   TCRef = erlang:monitor(process, Self),
 1632:                   PeerRef = erlang:monitor(process, Peer),
 1633:                   receive
 1634:                       {'DOWN',TCRef,_,_,Reason} ->
 1635:                           exit(Peer, Reason);
 1636:                       {'DOWN',PeerRef,_,_,_} ->
 1637:                           ok
 1638:                   end
 1639:           end),
 1640:     unlink(Peer),
 1641: 
 1642:     "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",Name," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1643: 
 1644:     %% We start tracing on the remote node in order to help debugging
 1645:     TraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),Name++".trace"),
 1646:     ct:log("Link to trace: file://~ts",[TraceLog]),
 1647: 
 1648:     spawn(Node,
 1649:           fun() ->
 1650:                   {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file,TraceLog),
 1651:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv),[c,m]),
 1652:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_writer),[c,m]),
 1653:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_reader),[c,m]),
 1654:                   %% dbg:tp(user_drv,x),
 1655:                   %% dbg:tp(prim_tty,x),
 1656:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,write_nif,x),
 1657:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,read_nif,x),
 1658:                   monitor(process, Self),
 1659:                   receive _ -> ok end
 1660:           end),
 1661: 
 1662:     #tmux{ peer = Peer, node = Node, name = Name }.
 1663: 
 1664: %% Start a tty, setup custom prompt and set cursor at bottom
 1665: start_tty(Config) ->
 1666: 
 1667:     Term = setup_tty(Config),
 1668: 
 1669:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1670:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1671:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1672:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1673: 
 1674:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1675: 
 1676:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 1677:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 1678:     %% position is.
 1679:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 1680: 
 1681:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 1682:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 1683:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 1684:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 1685:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 1686:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 1687: 
 1688: prompt(L) ->
 1689:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 1690:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1691:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 1692:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 1693: 
 1694: stop_tty(Term) ->
 1695:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 1696:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 1697: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 1698:     ok.
 1699: 
 1700: tty_name(Term) ->
 1701:     Term#tmux.name.
 1702: 
 1703: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 1704:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 1705:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1706:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 1707: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 1708:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1709:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 1710: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 1711:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 1712:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 1713:     [begin
 1714:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 1715:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 1716:      end || V <- Quotes].
 1717: 
 1718: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 1719: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 1720: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
 1721:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 1722: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 1723:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 1724: 
 1725: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 1726:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 1727: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 1728:                {AdjRow, AdjCol} = Where, Attempt) ->
 1729:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 1730:     case {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} of
 1731:         NewLocation -> NewLocation;
 1732:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1733:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 1734:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,{AdjRow, AdjCol}},
 1735:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 1736:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 1737:         _ ->
 1738:             timer:sleep(50),
 1739:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 1740:     end.
 1741: 
 1742: get_location(Term) ->
 1743:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1744:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1745:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1746: 
 1747: get_window_size(Term) ->
 1748:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1749:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1750:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1751: 
 1752: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 1753:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 1754: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1755:     Opts = #{},
 1756:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1757:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1758:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1759:     end,
 1760:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1761:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1762:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1763:                 error ->
 1764:                     OrigContent
 1765:                 end,
 1766:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 1767:         {match,_} ->
 1768:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1769:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1770:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1771:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1772:             ct:fail(match);
 1773:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1774:             ok;
 1775:         _ ->
 1776:             timer:sleep(500),
 1777:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1778:     end.
 1779: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 1780:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 1781: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 1782:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 1783: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1784:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1785:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1786:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1787:               end,
 1788:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1789:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1790:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1791:                   error ->
 1792:                       OrigContent
 1793:               end,
 1794:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 1795:         {match,_} ->
 1796:             ok;
 1797:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1798:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1799:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1800:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1801:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1802:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 1803:         _ ->
 1804:             timer:sleep(500),
 1805:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1806:     end.
 1807: 
 1808: get_content(Term) ->
 1809:     get_content(Term, "").
 1810: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 1811:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 1812:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 1813:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 1814:             C;
 1815:         [C] ->
 1816:             C
 1817:     end.
 1818: 
 1819: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 1820: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1821:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1822: 	old ->
 1823:             test_exit_initial(old);
 1824:         new ->
 1825:             test_exit_initial(old),
 1826:             test_exit_initial(new)
 1827:     end,
 1828:     ok.
 1829: 
 1830: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 1831:     rtnode:run(
 1832:       [{putline, ""},
 1833:        {putline, "2."},
 1834:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 1835:        {putline, "exit()."},
 1836:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 1837:        {putline, ""},
 1838:        {putline, "35."},
 1839:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 1840:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 1841: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 1842:     rtnode:run(
 1843:       [{putline, ""},
 1844:        {expect, "1> $"},
 1845:        {putline, "2."},
 1846:        {expect, "2"},
 1847:        {putline,"exit()."},
 1848:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 1849:        {expect, "1> $"},
 1850:        {putline, "35."},
 1851:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 1852: 
 1853: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1854:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 1855:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 1856:         {error, Reason} ->
 1857:             {skip, Reason};
 1858:         Tempdir ->
 1859:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 1860:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 1861:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 1862:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 1863:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 1864:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 1865:             ok
 1866:     end.
 1867: 
 1868: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 1869: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 1870: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 1871: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 1872: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 1873: %% on the current line.
 1874: %%
 1875: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 1876: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 1877: %% newline to happen.
 1878: %%
 1879: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 1880: %% we should.
 1881: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1882:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1883:         new ->
 1884:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 1885:             rtnode:run(
 1886:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 1887:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 1888:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 1889:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 1890:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 1891:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 1892:               ],
 1893:               [],
 1894:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 1895:         _ ->
 1896:             ok
 1897:     end,
 1898:     ok.
 1899: 
 1900: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 1901: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 1902: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 1903: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 1904: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 1905: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 1906: %% commands.
 1907: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1908:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 1909:     rtnode:run(
 1910:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 1911:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 1912:        {putline, "echo2."},
 1913:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 1914:        {putline, "echo3."},
 1915:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 1916:        {putline, "echo4."},
 1917:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 1918:        {putline, "echo5."},
 1919:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 1920:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 1921:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1922:     rtnode:run(
 1923:       [{sleep,100},
 1924:        {putline, ""},
 1925:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 1926:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 1927:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 1928:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 1929:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 1930:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 1931:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 1932:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 1933:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 1934:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 1935:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 1936:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 1937:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 1938:       ], [], [],
 1939:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 1940:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1941: 
 1942:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 1943:     rtnode:run(
 1944:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 1945:         {expect, "getline>"},
 1946:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 1947:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 1948:        ], [], [],
 1949:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 1950:     ok.
 1951: 
 1952: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 1953:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 1954:     rtnode:run(
 1955:       [{putline, "echo."},
 1956:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 1957:        {putline, "echo2."},
 1958:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 1959:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 1960:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 1961: 
 1962:     {ok, Logs} =
 1963:         rtnode:run(
 1964:           [{sleep,100},
 1965:            {putline, ""},
 1966:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 1967:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 1968:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 1969:            {expect, "echo"}
 1970:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 1971:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 1972: 
 1973:     rtnode:check_logs(
 1974:       "erlang.log.1",
 1975:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 1976:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 1977: 
 1978:     ok.
 1979: 
 1980: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 1981:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 1982:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 1983:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 1984:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 1985:     try
 1986:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 1987:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 1988: 
 1989:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 1990:         {ok, Logs1} =
 1991:             rtnode:run(
 1992:               [{putline, "echo."},
 1993:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 1994:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 1995: 
 1996:         ct:pal("~p",[Logs1]),
 1997:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 1998: 
 1999:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2000:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2001:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2002:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2003:             rtnode:run(
 2004:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2005:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2006:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2007: 
 2008:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2009: 
 2010:     after
 2011:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2012:     end,
 2013:     ok.
 2014: 
 2015: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2016:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2017: 
 2018:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2019:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2020: 
 2021:     {ok, Logs} =
 2022:         rtnode:run(
 2023:           [{putline, ""},
 2024:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2025:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2026:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2027:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2028: 
 2029:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2030:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2031:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2032:                       false,
 2033:                       Logs),
 2034:     ok.
 2035: 
 2036: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2037:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2038: 
 2039:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2040:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2041: 
 2042:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2043:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2044:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2045:     ok = file:close(D),
 2046: 
 2047:     {ok, Logs} =
 2048:         rtnode:run(
 2049:           [{putline, ""},
 2050:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2051:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2052:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2053:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2054: 
 2055:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2056:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2057:                       Logs),
 2058:     ok.
 2059: 
 2060: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2061:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2062: 
 2063:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2064:     rtnode:run(
 2065:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2066:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2067:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2068:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2069:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2070: 
 2071:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2072:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2073:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2074:     ok = file:close(D),
 2075: 
 2076:     {ok, Logs} =
 2077:         rtnode:run(
 2078:           [{putline, ""},
 2079:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2080:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2081:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2082:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2083:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2084: 
 2085:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2086:     ok.
 2087: 
 2088: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2089: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2090:     try
 2091:         rtnode:run(
 2092:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2093:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2094:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2095:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2096:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2097:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2098:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2099:     catch
 2100:         _:_ ->
 2101:             ok
 2102:     end.
 2103: 
 2104: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2105:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2106:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2107: 
 2108: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2109:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2110:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2111:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2112:     ].
 2113: 
 2114: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2115:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2116:     rtnode:run(
 2117:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2118:        %% {putline, ""},
 2119:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2120:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2121:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2122:        {putline, "echo."},
 2123:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2124:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2125:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2126:     ok.
 2127: 
 2128: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2129: 
 2130:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2131:     %% provider module.
 2132:     rtnode:run(
 2133:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2134:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2135:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2136:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2137: 
 2138:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2139:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2140:     rtnode:run(
 2141:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2142:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2143:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2144:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2145:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2146: 
 2147:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2148:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2149:     rtnode:run(
 2150:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2151:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2152:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2153:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2154:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2155: 
 2156:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2157:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2158:     rtnode:run(
 2159:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2160:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2161:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2162:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2163:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2164:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2165: 
 2166:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2167:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2168:     rtnode:run(
 2169:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2170:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2171:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2172:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2173:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2174:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2175: 
 2176:     ok.
 2177: 
 2178: load() ->
 2179:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2180:         {ok, crash} ->
 2181:             error(crash);
 2182:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2183:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2184:             ok;
 2185:         _ ->
 2186:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2187:     end.
 2188: 
 2189: add(_Line) ->
 2190:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2191:         {ok, crash} ->
 2192:             error(crash);
 2193:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2194:             %% Should return ok
 2195:             {error, badreturn};
 2196:         _ ->
 2197:             io:format("!", [])
 2198:     end.
 2199: 
 2200: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2201: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2202:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2203: 	old ->
 2204: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2205: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2206: 	new ->
 2207: 	    %% New shell tests
 2208: 	    rtnode:run(
 2209:               [{putline, ""},
 2210:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2211:                {putline, "2."},
 2212:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2213:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2214:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2215:                {putline, "s"},
 2216:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2217:                {putline, "c"},
 2218:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2219:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2220:                {putline, "35."},
 2221:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2222:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2223:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2224:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2225:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2226:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2227:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2228:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2229:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2230:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2231:                {putline, "c"},
 2232:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2233:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2234:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2235:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2236:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2237:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2238:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2239:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2240:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2241:                {putline, "k"},
 2242:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2243:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2244:                {putline, "c"},
 2245:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2246:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2247:                {putline, "i"},
 2248:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2249:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2250:                {putline, "?"},
 2251:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2252:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2253:                {putline, "h"},
 2254:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2255:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2256:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2257:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2258:                {putline, "35."},
 2259:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2260:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2261:               ]),
 2262:             ok
 2263:     end.
 2264: 
 2265: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2266: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2267:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2268: 	old ->
 2269: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2270: 	_ ->
 2271:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2272:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2273:             try
 2274:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2275:             after
 2276:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2277:             end
 2278:     end.
 2279: 
 2280: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2281: %% -noshell node.
 2282: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2283:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2284: 	old ->
 2285: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2286: 	_ ->
 2287: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2288:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2289:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2290:             try
 2291:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2292:             after
 2293:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2294:             end
 2295:     end.
 2296: 
 2297: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2298:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2299:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2300:                                    receive die ->
 2301:                                            ok
 2302:                                    end
 2303:                            end),
 2304:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2305:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2306:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2307:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2308: 
 2309:     rtnode:run(
 2310:       [{putline, ""},
 2311:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2312:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2313:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2314:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2315:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2316:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2317:        {putline, "j"},
 2318:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2319:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2320:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2321:        {putline, "c"},
 2322:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2323:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2324:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2325:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2326:        {expect, PidStr},
 2327:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2328:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2329:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2330:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2331:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2332:        {putline, "j"},
 2333:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2334:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2335:        {putline, "c"},
 2336:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2337:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2338:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2339:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2340:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2341:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2342:        {putline, "j"},
 2343:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2344:        {putline, "c"},
 2345:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2346:        {sleep, 100},
 2347:        {putline, "35."},
 2348:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2349:       ], RemNode),
 2350:     Pid ! die,
 2351:     ok.
 2352: 
 2353: %% Tests various control keys.
 2354: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2355:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2356:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2357:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2358:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2359:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2360:     rtnode:run(
 2361:       [{putline,""},
 2362:        {putline,"2."},
 2363:        {expect,"2"},
 2364:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2365:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2366:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2367:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2368:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2369:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2370:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2371:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2372:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2373:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2374:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2375:     ok.
 2376: 
 2377: wordLeft() ->
 2378:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2379:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2380:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2381:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2382: 
 2383: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2384:     End = "\eOF",
 2385:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2386:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2387: 
 2388: wordRight() ->
 2389:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2390:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2391:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2392:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2393: 
 2394: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2395:     Home = "\eOH",
 2396:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2397:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2398: 
 2399: %% Test that -remsh works
 2400: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2401:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2402:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2403:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2404: 
 2405:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2406:                {putline,"node()."},
 2407:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2408: 
 2409:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2410: 
 2411:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2412:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2413:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2414:     rtnode:run(
 2415:       PreCmds ++
 2416:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2417:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2418:           PostCmds,
 2419:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2420: 
 2421:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2422:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2423: 
 2424:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2425:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2426:                [], " ",
 2427:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2428: 
 2429:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2430: 
 2431:     ok.
 2432: 
 2433: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2434: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2435:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2436:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2437: 
 2438: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2439:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2440:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2441:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2442:      {putline, "s"},
 2443:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2444:      {putline, "c"},
 2445:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2446:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2447: 
 2448: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2449: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2450:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2451:     Domain =
 2452:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2453:             [] ->
 2454:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2455:             _ -> ""
 2456:         end,
 2457:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2458:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2459:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2460:             try
 2461:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2462:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2463:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2464:                 try
 2465:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2466:                            SNode,
 2467:                            STPid,
 2468:                            [{putline, ""},
 2469:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2470:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2471:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2472:                            CNode,
 2473:                            CTPid,
 2474:                            [{putline, ""},
 2475:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2476:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2477:                 after
 2478:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2479:                 end
 2480:             after
 2481:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2482:             end;
 2483:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2484:             Else
 2485:     end.
 2486: 
 2487: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2488: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2489:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2490:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2491:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2492:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2493:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2494:             try
 2495:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2496:                        SNode,
 2497:                        STPid,
 2498:                        [{putline, ""},
 2499:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2500:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2501:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2502:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2503:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2504:                 try
 2505:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2506:                            CNode,
 2507:                            CTPid,
 2508:                            [{putline, ""},
 2509:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2510:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2511:                 after
 2512:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2513:                 end
 2514:             after
 2515:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2516:             end;
 2517:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2518:             Else
 2519:     end.
 2520: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2521:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2522:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2523:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2524:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2525:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2526:             try
 2527:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2528:                        STPid,
 2529:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2530:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2531:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2532:             after
 2533:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2534:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2535:             end;
 2536:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2537:     end.
 2538: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2539:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2540:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 2541:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 2542:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 2543:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 2544:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 2545:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 2546:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2547:                     try
 2548:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2549:                             STPid,
 2550:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2551:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2552:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2553:                     after
 2554:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2555:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2556:                     end;
 2557:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2558:             end
 2559:     end.
 2560: 
 2561: printed_atom(A) ->
 2562:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
